intro: Cynanchica ophiolitica, commonly known as the mountain milkvetch, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant features a robust root system that allows it to thrive in poor, sandy soils. Its flowers are typically pale blue or purple, arranged in dense clusters, and it produces small, cylindrical legumes as fruits. Cynanchica ophiolitica plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
